description: Borrowed from Latin designatus, past participle of designare. Doublet of design.

entries.meaning: (UK) Used after a role title to indicate that the person has been selected but has yet to take up the role.

verbs.description: designate (third-person singular simple present designates, present participle designating, simple past and past participle designated)

entries.meaning: To mark out and make known; to point out; to indicate; to show; to distinguish by marks or description
examples: to designate the boundaries of a country
to designate the rioters who are to be arrested

entries.meaning: To call by a distinctive title; to name.
To indicate or set apart for a purpose or duty; â€” with to or for; to designate an officer for or to the command of a post or station.
